snippet: In interviews, speeches and in stealthier ways, Mr. Rubio has abruptly changed the course of his campaign to zero in on Mr. Cruz and reverse his gains among conservative voters.
abstract: Sen Marco Rubio has abandoned his previous strategy of trying to stay above fray in Republican presidential primary and has started questioning qualifications of Sen Ted Cruz in attempt to stall Cruz's momentum in Iowa among conservative voters; Rubio's campaign as well as allied political group have focused on trying to paint Cruz as weak on national security and to raise questions about his stance on illegal immigration.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: In interviews, speeches and in stealthier ways, Mr. Rubio has abruptly changed the course of his campaign to zero in on Mr. Cruz and reverse his gains among conservative voters.

headline.main: Marco Rubio, Switching Focus, Aims to Halt Ted Cruz’s Momentum
headline.print_headline: Rubio Changes Tactics, Aiming at a Rising Cruz
